thread.title: New Century Chorale brings love of choral music to Flint, surrounding communities
thread.title_full: New Century Chorale brings love of choral music to Flint, surrounding communities

author: ohtadmin
title: New Century Chorale brings love of choral music to Flint, surrounding communities
text:
FLINT — New Century Chorale is kicking off its 32nd concert season which is entitled Come Travel with Me. The first concert will be Sunday, Oct. 12 at 4 p.m. at St. Paul’s Episcopal Church in Flint located at 711 S. Saginaw St.
This concert is entitled A Choral Passport and will focus on songs from around the world – France, Israel, Kenya and other countries. This will be a benefit concert for a local organization, Beauty for Ashes.
A percentage of the ticket sales will be donated and a free will offering will be taken at the door.
Join artistic director Steven Holovach and plan to enjoy some great music.
Tickets are $15 at the door. The concert will also be live streamed and you may purchase tickets at https://newcenturychorale.square.site/ and a link will be e-mailed to you.
New Century Chorale is a local adult community choir of 35 members bringing the arts to Flint and the surrounding communities.
New Century Chorale is celebrating its 32nd season of enriching lives, one song at a time.
If you plan on attending please purchase your tickets online at http://www.newcenturychorale.org/ or call 810-771-8255.
